intro: Thesium dissitiflorum, commonly known as the woolly thesium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Thesium dissitiflorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
